preface.title: Preface
preface.para: HSQLDB (HyperSQL DataBase) is a modern relational database manager that conforms closely to the SQL Standard and JDBC specifications.

Early version of HSQLDB were released in the 2001-2002 period and were largely based on a previous open-source product named HypersonicSQL. Versions released in 2004-2005 featured several new capabilities and components, together with rewrite and enhancement of other SQL features. Versions 1.9 and 2.0, first released in 2009, feature a complete rewrite of most parts of the database engine. In the core engine, only a few classes are based on the original HypersonicSQL code to maintain compatibility with database files created with version 1.8.0.

This documentation covers HyperSQL versions 1.9 and 2.0. Any reference to version 2.0 in this documentation also applies to version 1.9 unless it is stated otherwise. The latest, updated version of this documentation can be found at http://hsqldb.org/doc/2.0/

If you notice any mistakes in this document, please email the author listed at the beginning of the chapter. You can find the emails in the list of developers on the SourceForge project site via http://hsqldb.org. If you have problems with the procedures themselves, please use the HSQLDB support facilities which are listed at http://hsqldb.org/support
